title: Economics for Everyone
text:
Course Description
This course introduces core economic concepts through real-world examples and policy applications. Topics include incentives, markets, externalities, and behavioral economics.

title: Economics for Everyone
text:
Prerequisites
No prior economics background required.

title: Economics for Everyone
text:
Coursework

Weekly problem sets
Midterm exam
Final project

title: Lecture 1: Incentives
text:
Why incentives matter

Policies change behavior

Behavior determines outcomes

Good intentions are not enough

title: Lecture 1: Incentives
text:
What is an incentive?

Anything that changes costs or benefits
Can be explicit or implicit
Often unintended

title: Lecture 1: Incentives
text:
Goodhart’s Law

When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure.


Metrics shape behavior
Optimizing the metric ≠ optimizing the objective

title: Lecture 1: Incentives
text:
Unintended consequences

People respond strategically
Responses occur on margins
Outcomes may reverse
